duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform complex analytical modeling to support implementation of SB100 and coordinate cost and reliability modeling to support decarbonization of the energy system.
Lead new modeling to rapidly evaluate changing grid needs as climate change escalates and new renewable and storage resources are added to the grid.
Identify and analyze optimal locations for targeted demand side investment given network constraints and determine impacts of clean energy investments on the transmission and distribution system.
Coordinate with energy reliability planning and procurement efforts in Energy Division, as well as other state, tribal, and federal governments.
Review modeling and analysis performed by other state agencies, as well as stakeholders and outside parties to ensure decision makers have the best information for regulatory proceedings.

education_certification.credential: Professional Engineer License, Bachelor's degree in Engineering (Master's preferred)
